comment: Hey there! I really appreciate how clearly you explain everything. It makes it super easy to understand.
Prof Dave I just watched my First 3 Videos and i Know this will be Epic! HUGE THANKS FOR THIS GREAT INPUT TO HUMANITY!

For context  this is for my memorization purposes and do not intend to become creepy      Professor dave here let's Talk about place values   Wheb we started countingnthings thousands of yeard ago we quickly realised that number's can get very big very fast, whether your counting grains of sand or stars in the night sky   Summing up, we made numbers work how they do csuse if we made unique symbols for every number we wouldnt be able to remember them all   There for we couldnt give every possible number its own unique symbol  We needed some kind of system that uses a small collection of sumbols over and over  To repersent very numerical value immagineable  That's why we came up with the notion of place values  Say your again counting apples  You get one two three all the way up to 9  Then when you hit ten this becomes a two digit number  That's because we place a one in the tens place while the units place goes back to 0 and starts again  After it gets to nine again the tens places goes to a two indicating that we've reached 10 twice while the units place goes back to zero This continues through thirty fourth fifty and when we reach ninety nine we've maxed out both the units place and the tens place  So we have to add the hundreds place  We place a one here indicating that we have reached one hundred while the other two places go back to zero  This process can continue ad infinitum  Every time all the digits reach nine we add a new digit to the left a one while all the others go back to zero  Thousands place ten thousands 100 thousands millions and so forth  This is a brilliant system because it allows us to repersent any number imaginable using the same 10 digits from zero to nine just  I'm combination that demonstrate various magnitudes  The place glaues where these digits can found indicaties how big or small the number is
Great vid!❤😊

I am a 13-year-old that is going into 8th grade. Math has always been the toughest subject for me, and I cannot even begin to fathom how much harder it's going to be for me if I don't truly understand the basics of math. When I was in 6th grade, I traveled abroad and didn't do math for an entire year because of the language barrier. Now, that I'm back in the US I’ve realized just how much that year had set me behind. My 7th grade year was full of anxiety and stress about math. Whenever I tried to understand what was going on in class, I just couldn’t get it. I am determined to fix this, so I can no longer feel inferior to my classmates, but just so i can be a good student and get good grades! Thank you so much for this opportunity. ( sorry for all the punctuation mistakes 😅. I am trying to get better at my writing skills as well 😁❤️)

@bigaaron  I am saying we humans now need entire chapters completed in under ten minutes to appreciate anything. No judgement on the channel or people enjoying and using it's content. More power to you.  Just a general comment on the time we live in.

@sanmatidhartikamath3771  Well, a review of the concepts in a compact form is what you want if what you're here for is review. I realized how much I had forgotten that I knew about math watching this video, which wouldn't happen as effectively if I had to go back and go through the entire Algebra 1 book to review. Instead I watch maybe an hour of review videos and realize what I already know and where my current math understanding comes from. Your comment comes accross as demeaning, which I'm sure you didnt mean. But a little awareness of how you might come across could benefit you.
